actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water, Wildlife, and Fisheries

official_title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to determine the feasibility of increasing the capacity of water storage, increasing power generation, improving water supply reliability and quality, improving water management efficiency, and improving ecosystem function and flood control on the San Joaquin River through the construction of a reservoir at Temperance Flat and other reasonable measures.
subjects: Federal aid to water pollution control
Federal aid to water resources development

summary.text: San Joaquin River Restoration Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to complete a study of the Upper San Joaquin River Basin in California to determine the feasibility of increasing water storage capacity and power generation and of improving water supply reliability and quality, water management efficiency, and ecosystem function and flood control on the San Joaquin River through the construction of a reservoir at Temperance Flat and other reasonable measures.

titles.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to determine the feasibility of increasing the capacity of water storage, increasing power generation, improving water supply reliability and quality, improving water management efficiency, and improving ecosystem function and flood control on the San Joaquin River through the construction of a reservoir at Temperance Flat and other reasonable measures.
